page.title: 13Oakley Airstrip
page.content: The Oakley airstip was constructed for the Second World War, it was used by Lancaster bombers, one of which crashed in the Thame Road .After the war its use as an aerodrome ceased. It has been used by British Leyland for the storage of cars. Nowadays the airfied has a single hanger on it.This is used for the storage of grain for the E.E.C. One of the James Bond films,"Octopussy" had scenes shot on the airstrip. Nowadays,the land has crops growing on it,and the runway is used by the villagers for walking their dogs,riding bicycles,flying model aeroplanes and some gliding. Auctions have been held there. Looking towards the future, an application has been made for its use as a skidpan and driving lesson centre by the Police.
